titleStmt.title: Robert McCoy et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9454

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency the Govnor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky the undersigned Citizens of Bracken County would respectfully represent that at the last term ^Feby Term 1861^ of the Bracken Circuit Court. Llewelyn Galaspie was fined one hundred and four dollars for obstructing the public highway, by setting his fence in a portion of the road, and a judgement for that amount was entered against him and the said Galspie being a ppoor man with a wife and several Children, the undersigned would respectfully ask your excellency to remit said fine, Yours respectfully
